Anatomic_Site_of_Lesion: Right tongue base, poorly-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma with basaloid features
Pathology_Details: Poorly-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma with basaloid features, positive for p16
Patient_Symptoms_at_Presentation: Dysphagia, hoarseness of voice, right otalgia
Treatment_Recommendations: External beam radiotherapy with concomitant chemotherapy
Follow_Up_Plans: Patient to be seen in medical oncology department, treatment planification within the next weeks
Patient_History_Status_Prior_Conditions: Polyrheumatoid arthritis, arterial hypertension, hypothyroidism, dyslipidemia, macular degeneration
Patient_History_Status_Previous_Treatmen: Actonel, calcium, Synthroid, Metoprolol, Prednisone 5 mg, Vitalux, Vitamin B12, Crestor, Senokot, Ativan
Clinical_Assessments_Radiological_Lesion: CT scan of the neck not available, chest x-ray showing no active disease, flexible nasopharyngolaryngoscopy remarkable for a right tongue base lesion measuring 3 cm
